column4: guys, i use hoary, when the i login (administrator), i can access terminal like root using "su - typing the root pwd" but i can access the 'terminal like root' when the login pwd works... So, it's not cool to have. I can be "su" using the administrator pwd
It's suposed to be like that?
sudo uses the users own password.  You don't have to set a user password.  sudo is only set up for the user created during install, after that you have to grant it explicitly
